articles.title: Mysterious brain syndrome grips Canada
articles.description:
Six years after they were first reported, debilitating neurological symptoms have shaken the province of New Brunswick and still have doctors in Canada stumped. 

Forty-eight people from the same small ...
articles.content: Gabrielle Cormier is one of the youngest patients afflicted by extreme fatigue, involuntary jerking movements, memory lapses and hallucinations. Photo / Chris Donovan, The New York TimesSix years aft… [+9149 chars]

articles.author: Darren Bernhardt
articles.title: Winnipeg's Ryerson elementary may change name to distance school from residential schools architect
articles.description: This could be one of the last years that Grade 6 students graduate from Ryerson elementary school in south Winnipeg.
articles.content:
This could be one of the last years that Grade 6 students graduate from Ryerson elementary school in south Winnipeg.

articles.author: Paul Palmeter
articles.title: Dalhousie board of governors approves new arena complex
articles.description: The Dal Event Centre, a multi-use facility with an arena and an alternate floor surface, will open in 2023.
articles.content:
The board of governors at Dalhousie University has approved plans for a new arena complex.
The facility will be called the Dalhousie Event Centre and will be built at 1246 LeMarchant St., the same s… [+1479 chars]

articles.author: Paul Palmeter
articles.title: Dalhousie mulls building new event centre with arena
articles.description: A document obtained by CBC News indicates Dalhousie's board of governors will vote Tuesday on whether to move forward with plans to construct a new arena.
articles.content:
Dalhousie University is considering building a new arena and event centre on campus.
The school's board of governors is scheduled to hold a meeting on Tuesday afternoon, and a document obtained by C… [+1026 chars]

articles.author: CBC News
articles.title: Advocates say more wheelchair training needed for N.S. occupational therapists
articles.description: A recent study by Dalhousie University's head of wheelchair research says occupational therapists in the province aren't feeling prepared when it comes to offering training for wheelchair skills.
articles.content:
Andrew Jantzen uses a wheelchair to get around, but he's never received adequate training on how to use it.
"A lot of the day-to-day stuff was just never introduced to me. It was a little strange go… [+4786 chars]
